dt: {bc}a change or shift from one state, subject, place, etc. to another

dt.t: a peaceful/orderly {wi}transition{/wi} of power
the actor's {wi}transition{/wi} to directing
the patient's {wi}transition{/wi} from the hospital to home
… the {wi}transition{/wi} from print reading to screen reading has increased our reliance on images …
The program works with newcomer families, and their students, to help support the {wi}transition{/wi} and integration into the school system.

The National Portrait Gallery's emphasis in its caricature collection underscores the field's subtle {wi}transition{/wi} between the world wars, when it went from mostly political uses to the light-hearted entertainment of celebrity caricature.
… having told all her griefs …, she was soon able to make a voluntary {wi}transition{/wi} to the oddities of her cousin …

Since the eye retains images slightly longer than it is actually exposed to them, it tends to meld two successive images into one, creating a smooth {wi}transition{/wi} between them. This phenomenon … is responsible for the illusion of motion in movies … and television.

dt: {bc}a period or phase in which such a change or shift is happening

dt.t: … you're at the cusp, kids. You're at the edge between childhood and everything that comes after. You're in {wi}transition{/wi}.
… non-REM sleep, which normally comprises the {wi}transition{/wi} between waking and REM sleep …
Perched at the very point of {wi}transition{/wi} between the Middle Ages and the Renaissance …

… today's average marrying age in America happens to coincide with a time of life when people have historically been less religiously active: the {phrase}transition period{/phrase} between moving out of your parents' house and starting a household of your own.

dt: {bc}something that links one state, subject, place, etc. to another {bc}a connecting part or piece

dt.t: [The front porch] served … as a vital {wi}transition{/wi} between the uncontrollable out-of-doors and the cherished interior of the home.

dt: {bc}a passage of discourse in which a shift (as of subject or location) is effected

dt.t: Every aspect of the book—its narrative {wi}transitions{/wi}, dramatic changes in pictorial scale, fluctuations of mood, interlinking of visual themes—is handled with pinpoint control.

dt: {bc}a segment connecting one dramatic scene to another

dt.t: Another misstep: the overuse of historical footage as a {wi}transition{/wi} between scenes. The images are disruptive and used completely out of context, often predating the era depicted here.

dt: {bc}a passage linking two sections of a piece of music {bc}{sx|bridge||}

dt.t: Furthermore, in two instances where new musical ideas are introduced … Mozart provides a musical {wi}transition{/wi} to connect the new section with the preceding one.

It's a complicated emotion, and one that needed to be looked at and felt for quite some time before being hooked up with anything as confining as an intro, a verse or three, a chorus, and a bridge ({wi}transition{/wi} between verse and chorus).
Occasionally composers will introduce their new key area abruptly. More often, however, they will effect a smooth {wi}transition{/wi} into the new key.

dt: {bc}a process by which a transgender person comes to live in accordance with their {d_link|gender identity|gender identity} through changes to their appearance and presentation often with the aid of medical procedures and therapies

While many associate this meaning of {it}transition{/it} with a process that involves hormone therapy, {d_link|gender confirmation surgery|gender confirmation surgery}, and legal name change, the term is also applied more broadly, since what transition involves can vary a great deal from person to person. In some cases, for example, the word {it}transition{/it} may simply refer to the adoption of new personal pronouns and/or a change in clothing, hairstyle, etc.
{bc}an abrupt change in energy state or level (as of an atomic nucleus or a molecule) usually accompanied by loss or gain of a single quantum of energy

shortdef: a change or shift from one state, subject, place, etc. to another
a period or phase in which such a change or shift is happening
something that links one state, subject, place, etc. to another : a connecting part or piece : such as

dt: {bc}to make a change or shift from one state, subject, place, etc. to another {bc}to make a {d_link|transition|transition:1}

dt.t: {wi}transitioning{/wi} to a new facility
a student {wi}transitioning{/wi} into college
Too many of the exterior shingles had {wi}transitioned{/wi} from weathered to warped, and the interior walls all needed a fresh coat of paint.

Because tornadoes are generated when these different air masses … collide, they are most common in the spring, when the weather is {wi}transitioning{/wi} from cold on the northern Plains to hot on the Gulf Coast.

dt: {bc}to cause (something or someone) to change or shift from one state, subject, place, etc. to another

dt.t: Teaching children to read first in their nonstandard Swedish dialect and then {wi}transitioning{/wi} them to standard Swedish speeds and improves the acquisition of reading skills.

In the United States, the company's plans for {wi}transitioning{/wi} prescription products to over-the-counter is easier now, as the Food and Drug Administration's (FDA) unwritten standards for such switches have evolved.

dt: {bc}to come to live in accordance with one's {d_link|gender identity|gender identity} through a process that involves changes to one's appearance and presentation often with the aid of medical procedures and therapies

dt.t: Not all transgender people {wi}transition{/wi}, and transitions look different for all kinds of people. They can be fast, or slow, and include lots of different kinds of treatments. … Transition is not one-size-fits-all. You may be comfortable altering your gendered existence without hormones or surgery; other people will feel those kinds of physical transitions are necessary for their survival.
… her [Jan Morris'] superb account of {wi}transitioning{/wi} from male to female in the 1960s, when it was even more difficult than it is now.

… she wanted to be helpful to other trans people who might not have had the same educational and cultural advantages she'd had. She had even written a guide about the practical aspects of {wi}transitioning{/wi}, such as changing your name and updating legal documents, for others who might be following a similar path.

shortdef: to make a change or shift from one state, subject, place, etc. to another : to make a transition
to cause (something or someone) to change or shift from one state, subject, place, etc. to another
to come to live in accordance with one's gender identity through a process that involves changes to one's appearance and presentation often with the aid of medical procedures and therapies
